Comment: Karpov tries to break up White's center.
Continuing to try and crack the White center.
Clearing the way for castling. But he never does so.
Missing a valuable chance. 12 PxP followed by 13 O-O, getting his King to safety, was called for.
Taking advantage of the mistake and planting his Knight in a powerful post with tempo.
Ensuring that the K can never find safety.
Winning a Pawn and pressing the attack forward.
Getting rid of one attacking piece...
...at the cost of creating this monstrous Pawn.
... this lightning-bolt finishes things. Karpov threatens 18... Q-B7 mate. If Ferrer tries 18 B-K2, Karpov has 18... B-N5! in reserve. So Ferrer resigns at once.
